alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Kofa; Parker Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 12:08PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central La Paz and north central Yuma Counties through 100 PM MST... At 1208 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kofa Wildlife Refuge, or 41 miles northeast of Martinez Lake, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quartzsite and Kofa Wildlife Refuge. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 8 and 35. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 35. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 81 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Kofa; Parker Valley
